@RobinAnnBarron @Behembaba Why? When it's inappropriate. Would you have Jamaicans in Kurosawas Seven Samurai? Would you have Eskimos in the Black Panther Wakanda community? Would you have Vikings in Apocalypto? Would you have Asians at the Little Big Horn? It's all about context. It's not exclusion at all.

@RachelJCushing not about people who look like me. I like Kurosawa's Seven Samurai. There's no Europeans in that either! So what? I wouldn't attack him for not being inclusive or diverse in his casting. It was about ancient Japan! And that's fine. Wokism is destroying culture with abandon! - 2/2

Toshiro Mifune 
Toshiro Mifune (1920-1997) was a Japanese actor. He is best known for his 16-film collaboration (1948–1965) with Akira Kurosawa in such works as Rashomon, Seven Samurai, The Hidden Fortress. He often portrayed samurai or rōnin who were usually coarse and gruff.
